pageContext.claim: “Somebody said, Oh, but we had $1.6 billion and they haven't spent it. The reason we haven't spent it is because the contractors are building it. And unlike governments -- and this government, in particular -- I like paying after it's built instead of before it's built.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is spinning a fantasy here. There has been no change in government contracting and payment practices since he became president. Ironically, he may be responding to a Democratic talking point that already had been debunked by The Fact Checker.
